trends: There have been no other sightings in Spencerport
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Two bright star objects moving NE one in front of the other in formation. The first dimmed as it increased altitude slightly and accelerated steadily and dimmed to nothing... as the first was dimming the second object began the exact same process.
divs: sighting detailsat approximately 9:19pm september 8th 2009, i stepped out onto my back deck (lights off). as i shut the door (facing due north), i turned my head up and to the west. above (high in sky), something immediately caught my eye. i focused my attention on the stars, but it appeared one was moving slowly. i looked carefully and noticed a second 'star' (what i can describe as a distance of 12 inches if i were to point at the objects with each hand). i did not see any blinking lights or pulsing or colors... simply silent movement of what appeared as bright stars. the speed and direction of the objects would be similar to an approach pattern over lake ontario to turn around near the rochester pier to land at roc. however, this was entirely different. silent, no other visible aircraft in sky. the objects' altitude can not be determined... thus, speed can not be determined. i had the sense that the objects were rather high... the sky was clear with average humidity. thus, the speed would be impressive. the whole episode may have lasted less than 30 seconds covering a third of the sky. the two bright star objects moved ne one in front of the other in formation. the first dimmed as it increased altitude slightly and accelerated steadily and dimmed to nothing... as the first was dimming the second object began the exact same process. the rate of acceleration and dimming of brightness was consistent. i think the angle of the light on craft or plane may have had something to do with the dimming effect. it was clearly not a pair of planes on approach. i wondered if it was helocopters or c-130s flying to fort drum, but the pattern of acceleration (not sure if out of bounds for known aircraft)... was highly unusual. also, having lived at my house for 8 years and in this general area my whole life, this was unique. the thing is, there was never any noise... i waited about 3 minutes for any noise to arrive... nothing. also, after the objects brightness dimmed and got smaller, the speed and slight upward direction was amazing if indeed at high altitude... that would mean high speed and no noise. i would describe the acceleration as smooth (no kicking in phase)... the objects acceleration rate compounded as the object dimmed to not being visible. it appeared that each object began this process at approximately the same location... one before the other. (no video or photo) \ personal observation from home near intersection of chambers street and route 36 (washington street) in the town of ogden, spencerport zip code 14559
